CareerCard.Title: IPS Officer
CareerCard.Overview: An IPS Officer is a member of the Indian Police Service, responsible for maintaining law and order, ensuring public safety, and preventing crime. They play a critical role in enforcing the law and building public trust.

Benefits: Opportunity to serve and protect the community.
Ability to make a significant impact on public safety and justice.
Job Challenges: High risk and exposure to danger.
Irregular working hours and shift duties.
Emotional stress from dealing with critical incidents.

Dual Impact Highlights.Personal Growth: IPS Officers develop strong leadership, crisis management, and decision-making skills while working under pressure.
Dual Impact Highlights.Community Impact: They contribute to public safety by maintaining law and order, which enhances community trust and overall societal well-being.

Level1ScenarioCards.Title: Initial Challenge 1
Level1ScenarioCards.Description: An entry-level IPS Officer is confronted with a local protest that threatens public order. The officer must decide how to handle the situation while ensuring safety and maintaining community trust.

DecisionCards.Option A: Engage in dialogue with protest organizers to address their concerns and de-escalate tensions.

DecisionCards.Option B: Deploy a strategic police presence to control the situation and ensure public safety.

Level2ScenarioCards.Title: Advanced Challenge 1
Level2ScenarioCards.Description: Facing a surge in criminal activities, an IPS Officer must balance strict enforcement with maintaining community relations during a prolonged crime wave.

DecisionCards.Option A: Implement community policing initiatives to build trust while enforcing the law strictly.

DecisionCards.Option B: Adopt a zero-tolerance approach to deter criminal activity, even if it strains community relations.
